title.narrative: Basic Integrated Health and Nutrition Assistance to Refugees and the Host Community in Gentil

description.narrative: Gentil Hospital in Maban County provides basic emergency health and nutrition services to an estimated 60,000 refugees from both Yusuf Batil and Gendrassa camps, as well as an additional 15,000 people from the host community. Due to lack of resources and fundin circumstances, Gentil has struggled to accomodate the high influx of IPDs. Gentil's emergency response (ER) department was providing 60 consultations per day in January 2015 and before down scaling services in October 2015, the hospital's IPD was admitting an average of 50 patients per month. From January to September, the hospital's maternity department on average assisted with over 200 deliveries per month. Facility staff records indicate the hospital provided approximately 20 referrals to Bunj per month for in-patient and out-patient services and delivery complications. RI provides Basic integrated health and nutrition assistance to the refugee and host community population in Gentil (BIHNA) program in order to support the continuation of these life-saving services. Specifically, RI continued Gentil's in-patient and emergency response (ER) departments, and maternity ward and re-activate in-patient and out-patient therapeutic feeding. RI will also ensure the referral system to and from Gentil and Maban's referral hospital in Bunj is maintained.
